2052.subject: VPA
2052.descrlong: Provides students with a critical view of the history of Chicana/o art focusing on El Movimiento and its contemporary manifestations in art and culture. Addresses issues of cultural reclamation, public space, gender and sexuality, and rural/urban migration. Students apply strategies of iconographic and media analysis to visual materials. (Offered spring semester.)
